intro: Antidesma vaccinioides, commonly known as the black mangrove, is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Indian Ocean and the Pacific, including parts of Southeast Asia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas, often in brackish or saline soils, and is adapted to tidal environments. Its fruits are small, dark berries that contain seeds dispersed by water or birds.
